Judul: SAMPLING GRID OPTIMIZATION ON FAN DRILLING DATA USING DECLUSTERING GEOSTATISTICAL METHOD
Abstrak:
Sampling selection on fan drilling pattern with specific grid (interval) generated a problem regarding the optimum sampling interval. The presence of different data
distribution on various places creates spatial data clustering. The objective of this research is to optimize the sampling interval on fan drilling pattern. Based on the
spatial variability of Cu-Au grades on several intervals pattern from 1 m to 15 m, the optimum sampling grid was determined. Moreover, the declustered weighted data were
used to yield the unblased distribution data in the optimum sampling interval. The result showed that in general the range of variogram Cu grade was longer than Au grade.
Conseguently the Cu grade had lower variability or higher continuity than Au grade. The kriging variance showed that Cu-Au grades with 15 m sampling grid had the smallest
variability with the variance 0.84 for Cu grade and 11.42 for Au grade compared to the data that is yielded by other sampling grid. The average declustered weight values for a
certain elevation range gave the depiction of optimum rate in the corresponding elevation range. Generally this research concluded that the optimum sampling intervals
were smaller from upper toward lower ends of drillholes.
